# Introduction
This class will consist of 6-8 two-hour session held Friday mornings at 7. We will hold it in a conference room in SLC office, and by Skype.

## Prerequesites
You need only a desire to improve your data handling and analysis skills and a few installs of software on your computer!

### Installs
The following steps will set you up for the class. You will need to download the `.exe` files somewhere on your hard drive, then call IT to have them run the installs. **IT Number** 1-866-257-5984
Do not use the online IT services reauest, just call them.


1. Download the R programming language, if you have not already. Dowload the version for Windows and put it somewhere  you can find on your computer (e.g., My Documents).

[Download R](https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/old/3.4.4/){target="_blank"}

2. Download R Studio, the prefered integrated development environemnt (IDE) for R. Dowload the version for Windows and put it somewhere  you can find on your computer (e.g., My Documents). Select the **FREE** version to download.

[Download R Studio](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/){target="_blank"}


3. Download GIT, the primary file version control software for programming. Download the Windows version and put it somewhere  you can find on your computer (e.g., My Documents).

[Download GIT for Windows](https://git-scm.com/downloads){target="_blank"}

## Create an R Script
* Evertyhing in R is `Case-Sensitive`
* Use a `.R` script file for your work, and use the `Console` for intermittent actions.

## Basic R Commands

* get(wd) - Displays the working directory, where R will read from and write to.
* sessionInfo() - Displays R version, and attached function `packages`

```{r brc, results='hide'}

#Check working directory
getwd()

#Check out session info
sessionInfo()

```
